-   IUCN: Least concern; Florida: Native, widely distributed
-   **Rarity note:** Distributed throughout Florida, but not often observed.

## Natural history notes

The Staghorn Clubmoss (Palhinhaea cernua) is not a true moss but is more closely related to ferns. It is the largest of the clubmoss species and occurs in subtropical environments, typically in wet savannas and other moist, disturbed areas.
